Reviews.Content: Very lovely place! Stayed with my boyfriend at Risata for 9 nights in November 2008. Very cosy and nice hotel. Beautiful gardens, nice and clean swimming pool. Very friendly staff. Ms Ira kindly assisted during our stay. Rooms were clean and quit good equiped.The breakfast was quite good but poor choice of dietary cookery.This hotel we can recommend to people of different age groups and nationalities (e.g. we're from Russia, my boyfriend is 28 y.o. and I'm 24 y.o.).Probably will return to Risata next time.
Reviews.Author: Annewk

Reviews.Content: not a pleasant stay We did not enjoy our stay at this hotel at all.we firstly arrived late in the after noon and had to wait 45 minutes for our room to be cleaned. The room was not what it looks like on the photos on the website. It was very dark, with 1 window looking out onto a pathway.the prices for drinks at the hotel are silly compared what you get on the streets. the beach that you walk to is terrible. So to get to Kuta beach it takes a while
Reviews.Author: Monkeypalace

Reviews.Content: Nice Stay We only stayed here because we were unable to get a room at the Santika. I wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. The room was a litle small as we had 3 single beds but it was manageable. With a double bed there would have been plenty of room. The rooms were cleaned meticulously every day and there were always plenty of towels etc. The breakfast was great with something for everyone. Staff were fine and the pool area was lovely. Only complaint is that there are not enough umbrellas so you have to get up early to get a decent sunbed otherwise you roast. The temperature of the pool was just wonderful and no matter how hot you could just dive in and feel refreshed without freezing. Love the Santika but the premier pool is always absolutely freezing. There are no safes in the room but we all used the hotel deposit boxes and never had a problem. The lobby, restaurant, pool and gardens are very nice and I would honestly stay here again. Do be warned the actual street is one of the worst!!! The paths are worse than normal and you do normally have to walk to JL Kartika Plaza to get a cab. Overall a really enjoyable stay.
Reviews.Author: lorrienne

Reviews.Content: "Nice Pool and Garden"       Yeah - thats the sign ... Risata
Reviews.Author: rusphillove

Reviews.Content: Risata tuban We spent a week at the Risata in June. As this was our first time to Bali we were unsure of whether to stay in Kuta or not and decided the location of the Risata was a good compromise. The hotel is about 15-20 minutes walk from the centre of Kuta and about 10 from the Discovery Mall. The hotel also runs a shuttle service but we found that it is was easier (and probably quicker) to walk as there is very heavy traffic along the route.The hotel itself is very good, the pool area is lovely with lots of sunbeds, the staff are very attentive and friendly and get to know you after a few days.The buffet breakfast was excellent with lots of choice and changed every day, again here the staff were great and the food good. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the evening and it always seemed very quiet.Rooms are of a good size and clean, we were a bit disappointed not to get a balcony with our room but found the room perfectly adequate - king size beds, good shower, no safety deposit box but this can be done at reception.The hotel grounds are also well tended, although beware of the bats flying around at night. We also used the fitness centre which is very small.All in all a good experience.
Reviews.Author: squirrell20

Reviews.Content: Hidden Jewel We recently stayed in Bali for three weeks with our 4 kids. This is our 3rd/4th trip to Bali, but the first time post-bombing and with the kids. Our 1st week was at the Risata, which is by far the best Kuta-based Hotel we have stayed in. The hotel is primarily time-share based and this is how we came to stay there. We did have to do a 90 min presentation, which was very relaxed and easy. The hotel is gold-crown rated which is the highest standard in time-share, however, maintains a 3 star rating for tax purposes, so don't be afraid of its 3 star rating, it is very spacious and luxurious. The pool is huge with a swim up bar that has AUD$5 pizzas and happy hour every arvo. The restaurant is very nice with well priced meals (for resort prices) There are also daily activities and information sessions around the pool area. There is a free ATM right at the entrance to the Hotel. (The Risata accepts AMEX, as do a lot of places in Bali. AMEX sought of sponsors the airport. Their currency conversion fee is much higher than Visa however, so don't be tricked. Ask before you travel) There are lots of very good, very cheap restaurants located nearby and because it is not close to Legian St, the prices were very competitive, and quality of foods outstanding. Pantai Kuta Restaurant is on the beach, just around the corner for beautiful, fresh seafood. $15 for +500g lobsters without the hassle of travelling to Jimbaran Bay. There is another rest. on the main road, about 3 mins walk from the back entrance, that does massive, all-you-can-eat b/fast, for about $5. The Risata is located on the dead end section of Jl Kartika Plaza and as such, has little through traffic/noise. It is only a 20000rp ($2.50) BlueBird taxi from the airport, but you don't hear any aircraft noise. Nearby salons are $6 for hour-long massages or body-scrubs. The back entry to the Hotel is a short-cut back to the main street and all the shopping you can handle. A small laneway just near the Pantai Restaurant has laundry shops that wash a basket of washing for $2, and iron it for the same amount, in 24 hrs. It is 5 mins walk to the Centro Shopping Mall/ Waterbom Park area. Centro has THE BEST bakery ever invented. Also genuine, brand name shopping outlets. Kuta Square is about 7 min walk or 10000rp taxi.($1.20) Kuta Square has the Matahari Supermarket for supplies, and has a free ATM, as well as the best money changer(at the side of the suprmrkt) She usually has the highest rate, no commission and gives you the right amount, first time, every time. Well worth the trip to Kuta Sq. We found the cheapest, easiest way of getting around Kuta is the BlueBird Taxis. They do not even attempt to rip you off or barter and are much cheaper than private drivers. Tuban beach is only 100m from the hotel entrance. If you walk down there you can organise all your transport arrangements for your stay, day trips, even boats for surfing/fishing/diving. The ladies operating the corner stall also do very good, cheap plaits, pedicure/manicures etc.  $50 for mum and 2 daughters for hair plaits, toe/ fngr nails, mini massages. A must if you have children is to visit the Marine Safari Park at Taman (45mins) Take your swimmers as there is a water park, funpark, zoo and safari all included for about US$20 each. There's camel/elephant rides. You can pat/hold a lion cub, orangutan, snake and with bird/monkey shows, it basically combines all other parks. Forget the hassle of Legian St, Kuta Beach, or Melasti Street. Tuban has everything and more, with much less hassle and cheaper also. You cannot possibly be disappointed by The Club Risata. Guaranteed
Reviews.Author: sweet6deans

Reviews.Content: Loved This Resort! I stayed here a couple of years ago but it was a stay to remember. Because I came during the low peak season, the staff immediately upgraded me to a Junior Suite. The resort is small, just the way I like it and the landscaping is nice. The room was also nicely decorated.However, it is a bit far to walk to Kuta and need to take a taxi if you want to enjoy Kuta.
Reviews.Author: asturi

Reviews.Content: Perfect !!! It was my first time in Bali. Bali is such a nice, charming and intriguing destination. I will definitely return to Bali soon. Adding to my wonderful trip was one of the best resort I've ever been, Risata Bali Resort. (I stayed in Junior Suite.) Not in term of luxury scale, but about its charming staffs, wonderful facilities, cleanliness in every details, serenity, and cosy accommodation. Next time in Bali will stay at Risata for sure.Pom (Thailand)
Reviews.Author: Pom8788

Reviews.Content: Wonderful We loved this hotel! Absolutely great value for money! The staff is fantastic - very friendly and after a week they felt like friends. The breakfast is good and the pool area great. The great thing about the Risata is its location, there is a food store close by, a place were you can rent a scooter next door (great to explore the island on your own) and the fact that you feel independent while traveling is great. The rooms are quite spacious, has air-con that actually works and hot water. You also get bottled water every morning. The only downside is that there are no bath tubs in the rooms. Other then that - it is a hotel that I can truly recommend.
Reviews.Author: AnndeeCapeTown

Reviews.Content: Risata - a beautiful location This was our fourth time that we stayed at the Risata Hotel and we will be heading down there again February 2008. We have nothing but praise to say about the hotel. The staff are incredible and really they all try to get to know all of their guests.  My husband and I have lived in the tropics for many years so it was not necessary for us to be staying at a hotel on the beach. The beach from the Risata is so close and yes I must admit it, the beach, is not very clean. But you can walk for miles along the beach which we seem to do every day that we are in Bali. Because of the location of the Risata, it is very quiet - traffic wise and in all the years that we have stayed there, the tourists in the Risata seem to respect other tourists in regards to being noisey well into the evening. The location to other areas is within walking distance or else a very short taxi ride. Breakfast is quite basic but a good variety and lots of it. Coffee is superb. Rooms are basic and very clean and room enough for two. Gardens are lovely and well kept. I really can't say enough about the Risata. We are so pleased with everything that we continue to go back and stay at the Risata. We love it there.
Reviews.Author: Paradisefor2

Reviews.Content: A good place as a base We went to Risata Bali on a timeshare exchange and it was an inexpensive exchange points wise so we were happy with what we got- that considering.The beach at Tuban was grotty and there was rubbish everywhere and you couldn't move for hawkers- we know they are trying to make a living but in the end you just staying by the pool.People we spoke to said they went up to the waters edge and saw feaces.Our unit was fine but when we ran water it stank of sewerage.This clears after about 3 days or sooner if you run the water for half an hour or so-Shopping is inexpensive in Kuta but we found our exchange better used as a rest and a base for day trips up inland.As Rci members we got a 20% discount off a driver for a day and did several cheap full day trips .We also went on a Cruise to Lembogan Island and stayed in Coconuts Reef Resort overnight- got 15% discount as Rci Timeshare members. It was great and the pool and views at this resort were outstanding!We found the staff very accommodating at Risata and the meals inexpensive- we got discounts as timeshare members.The rooms were large- we only had a hotel room and it was big.We enjoyed our stay.We thought our hotel seemed to compare well with others in the vacinity.The pool is private to outsiders.In some resorts you could stare into the pool from the roadside.They offer a free shuttle to the airport on your way home
Reviews.Author: oysterfiend

Reviews.Content: Risata fantastic We purchased an RCI Timeshare unit there some years ago and have only had the opportunity to stay there about 3 times since, however we could not have lucked into a better timeshare in my books. Can't speak highly enough of the location - close to some great restaurants, waterbom park and shopping, 20 min walk into Kuta. Hotel gardens are some of the best I've seen, and each time we've stayed the staff have been very friendly (1st name basis in 2 days and keep a watchful eye on the kids) you also get to use some of the neighbouring motels facilities. Pool area has a swim up bar and a great pizza oven for those nights when you are just too lazy to move too far.Lots of Aussie's also have timeshare units in this complex and they come back year after year.We are planning a trip for next year, so if anyone out there has stayed in the general hotel rooms since they have been renovated I would love to know what they are like, so I can recommend to the families coming over with us.
Reviews.Author: lottoismine

Reviews.Content: Cat茅gorie moyenne       Les jardins de l'h么tel
Reviews.Author: babelilu
